bio:
Gustav Vigeland was a Norwegian sculptor best known for his work at the Vigeland Park in Oslo, Norway. He was born in 1869 in Mandal, Norway, and studied at the Royal School of Art and Design in Kristiania (now Oslo). Throughout his career, Vigeland created more than 200 bronze, granite, and cast iron sculptures, many of which are now housed in Vigeland Park.

Gustav Vigeland is considered to be one of Norway's greatest sculptors, and his works have been widely recognized and acclaimed for their emotional power and technical mastery. Today, Vigeland Park is a testament to his life's work and continues to be a source of inspiration for visitors from around the world.
